snippet: James Van de Velde was never charged in the death of the student, Suzanne Jovin, which remains unsolved.
abstract: James Van de Velde, Yale University lecturer who was identified as a suspect in 1998 killing of student Suzanne Jovin, has settled his lawsuit against the university and the New Haven Police Department; Van de Velde, who was never charged, claims in lawsuit that being named a suspect violated his civil rights and damaged his reputation, career and health.
lead_paragraph: James Van de Velde was never charged in the death of the student, Suzanne Jovin, which remains unsolved.

headline.seo: Man Named in Yale Student’s ’98 Killing Settles Suit
headline.main: Man Named in Student’s ’98 Killing Settles Lawsuit Against Yale and Police
headline.print_headline: Man Named in’98 Killing Settles Suit vs. Yale
